Legal_Issue: Whether the Member erred in rejecting the refugee claim based on subjective fear, timing of departure, and relevance of country conditions
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed risk upon return; delay in leaving Italy was due to confirmation of risk in May 2001; country conditions were relevant to objective risk assessment
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: Granted judicial review, quashed the decision, remitted for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Immigration and Refugee Board rejected claim based on lack of credible subjective fear and timing
Grounds_for_Claim: Errors in assessing subjective fear, timing of departure, and relevance of country conditions
Legal_Standard: Patent unreasonableness for factual findings; correctness for legal issues
Assessment_Factor: Subjective fear, credibility, timing of departure, country conditions upon return
Credibility_Assessment: Member found lack of credible subjective fear
Evidence_Used: Country condition reports, applicant testimony, timeline of events
Application_Basis: Separate consideration of protection needs under Section 97
Evidence_Assessed: Timing of departure, evidence of risk in country of origin, applicant's explanation for delay
Relief_Sought: Quashing of decision and remittal for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: Section 97 requires individualized assessment of protection needs
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to properly consider country conditions despite objective risk
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution upon return to country of origin
Cause_Description: Applicants challenged denial of refugee status due to errors in evaluating evidence and legal standards
Evidence_Handling: Country conditions dismissed due to perceived lack of subjective fear
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 97 â€“ failure to separately assess protection needs
Evidence_Issues: Weight assigned to subjective fear over objective country conditions
Evidence_Assessment: Member failed to link country conditions to objective risk despite reasonable delay
Decision_Rationale: Error in dismissing country conditions due to subjective fear assessment; delay was reasonable
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient consideration of objective evidence of risk
